intro: Scutellaria minor var. elatior, commonly known as the greater blueweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Scutellaria minor var. elatior is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
